post_text: September 24, 2014 at 10:57 AM#1Hi,I am wondering how to create a macro for editing values or attributes through a cuelist. Let's say I want to bring channel 1 thru 6 down 6% if their values are above 50 for the entire cuelist. For an idividual, active cue, I would make a macro which goes:IfOutput channel 1 thru 6 at 50 thruAt -6Update /cIf I would make it for a cuelist, I could add a >>> and Go Macro, to make it recursive. But how will I make the makro stop running at the end of the cuelist?

posts.post_text: September 24, 2014 at 1:34 PM#2version 3.0.0.x introduced the Search and Replace commands exactly for this purpose.check out the releasenotes for syntax-description:http://help.malighting.com/view/topic/Top…eNotes_3_0.htmlthere is also several predefined macros for general replace scenariosyour examle case could go something like thisCodeSearch Channel 1 Thru 6 If Sequence 1finds the places in Sequence 1 where channel 1 thru 6 is presentCodeReplace At 50 Thru 100 With 44 Thru 94 If SearchresultReplaces values between 50 and 100 with values that are 6% lower, in the objects found in the previous search (ch. 1-6 /seq 1)
